body.p: Paragraph 20 requires an entity to determine when an item of property, plant and equipment is available for use. The Board was informed of differences in how entities make that determination, and considered suggestions to clarify when an asset is available for use. Some of those making this suggestion said the existence of significant proceeds before intended use might indicate that an asset is already available for use before it is determined to be so. In their view, such a clarification would reduce the amount of proceeds being deducted from the cost of an asset than had previously been the case and, thus, would address the matter identified in paragraph BC16B without changing how those proceeds are recognised.
